results.title: A Better breed
results.brief_description: An account of the mechanism by which inherited characteristics are handed on from generation to generation, and an introduction to Mendel’s Laws of heredity. Gives examples of the inheritance of one or more characteristics; complete and incomplete dominance; and the recombinations of characteristics resulting in new types; refers to the practical aspects of this in connection with animal husbandry. No other credits available.

results.title: Best laid plans
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Don Anderson and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Two boys, one a diabetic, are overdue after a bushwalk. Basic bush search techniques are described in detail as rescue workers hunt for the boys.

results.title: Best friends
results.creator_credit: Bob Browning, Robert Verrall, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film portraying the effects of cigarette smoke on the heart and lungs. What the noxious fumes of tobacco do to the defenceless lung tissue shouldn’t happen to an enemy, let alone a friend, as the film convincingly illustrates. For young viewers at an age where they might be enticed to take up smoking.

results.title: The Best damn fiddler from Calabogie to Kaladar
results.creator_credit: Peter Pearson, Barrie Howells, John Kemeny and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A story from an Upper Ottawa Valley logging community, about a man who chooses the unfettered life and uncertain income of an itinerant bush worker, even though it means that his family live poorly. The film is a study of the effects on family life of isolation and deprivation. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: The Bessemer converter
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare, Film Producers Guild and Merton Park
results.brief_description: This film describes the structure and operation of the Bessemer Convertor for making steel. Shows the raw materials, explains the chemical reactions which occur in the convertor, and points out the difference between basic and acid convertors.

results.title: The Bergen International Festival
results.brief_description: Describes the international cultural festival held in Bergen, Norway each year. The festival, attended by people from all over the world, is dedicated to the memory of Edvard Grieg. Outdoor theatre, philharmonic orchestras, folk dancing displays, ballet, singing and painting are some of the attractions. Concerts are held in historic buildings all over the town. Birgit Nilsson sings and finally the Bergen Harmonia plays Grieg’s Concerto in A Minor.

results.title: Berfunkle
results.creator_credit: Bill Murray, Stu Knickerbocker and Portafilms
results.brief_description: Introduces the problems involved in communication; in use of words as symbols of things and concepts. This animated film considers the problems of verbal communication as it follows the humorous misadventures of a poor soul trying to find the exact meaning of the word “Berfunkle”.

results.title: Benjamin Franklin
results.brief_description: Covers Franklin’s youth, commercial success, experiences in London, and his political career, culminating in his Presidency of the United States of America. No other credits available.

results.title: Benedictus
results.brief_description: A mood film which attempts to convey the passage of human life. Simple still nature photography is used to illustrate the theme, with the camera focussing and de-focussing on the subject. A lyrical flute accompaniment gives emphasis to this quiet unassuming film. No other credits available.

results.title: Beneath the dream
results.creator_credit: Peter Pastorelle, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Fuku and Lee are two young Chinese women helping underprivileged youngsters on the island of Hong Kong. One teaches the island’s many working children at a part-time school. The other runs a mobile library (supplied by UNICEF) bringing books, a chance for recreation and learning, to children living along the shores in sampans.
